**Meeting Overview**:  
The Ad Hoc Committee on General Investigating and Ethics of the City of Dallas will convene on May 2, 2024, at 3:00 PM. The meeting will take place both via videoconference and in-person at the Council Briefing Room, City Hall. The primary purpose is to discuss city actions regarding the acquisition of the property at 7800 N. Stemmons Freeway and to consider an audit of the due diligence process related to this purchase.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the May 4, 2023, meeting.
2. A detailed briefing on all actions taken by the city concerning the 7800 N. Stemmons Freeway property, including timelines, costs, and responsibilities.
3. Consideration of a request for the City Auditor to conduct a limited-scope audit of the due diligence process for the property purchase and related activities.

**Important Details**:  
The briefing will cover the timeline and costs associated with the acquisition and occupancy of the 7800 N. Stemmons Freeway property. The proposed audit aims to evaluate the cityâ€™s due diligence against industry standards, focusing on inspections and permitting before employee relocation.

**Action Items**:  
The committee will seek approval for the minutes from the previous meeting and will discuss and potentially approve the request for an audit by the City Auditor regarding the property purchase process. An executive session may be held if necessary to discuss legal or real estate matters.
